item.title: 消费者支出疲软，TJX 预测年销售额增长低于预期
item.description: 周三，TJX Cos 预测其年度可比销售额增长低于华尔街预期，这表明该非价格零售商在严峻的经济形势下正在与预算意识较强的顾客减少消费作斗争。【原文：TJX Cos forecast its annual comparable sales growth below Wall Street estimate on Wednesday, in a sign the off-price retailer battles reduced spending from budget-conscious customers in a tough economy.】

item.title: 意大利在劳动力供应调查中没收 DHL 4900 万美元
item.description: 检察官的文件显示，意大利警方从物流巨头德国邮政敦豪（DHL）在当地的一个部门扣押了 4680 万欧元（4910 万美元），这是对涉嫌与非法劳动力供应有关的税务欺诈行为进行的最新调查的一部分。【原文：Italian police have seized 46.8 million euros ($49.1 million) from a local unit of logistics giant Deutsche Post DHL as part of the latest investigation into alleged tax fraud linked to illicit labour supply, prosecutors' documents showed.】

item.title: 标准普尔500指数2025年底将上涨9%，但与特朗普相关的不确定性因素增多
item.description: 路透社民意调查显示，股票策略师认为，2025 年美国 500 指数将上涨约 9%，但波动性可能会增加，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布的一系列关税、裁员和政策变化会加剧不确定性。【原文：The S&P 500 will finish 2025 up about 9% from now, but volatility will likely increase as a barrage of tariff announcements, job cuts and policy changes from President Donald Trump fuels uncertainty, according to equity strategists in a Reuters poll.】

item.title: 乌克兰概述美国矿产交易
item.description: 乌克兰总理透露了与美国达成的矿产协议草案的细节，称其措辞表明华盛顿支持基辅获得安全保障的努力，但目前还没有更具体的内容。【原文：Ukraine's prime minister disclosed the details of a draft minerals deal with the United States, saying its wording showed Washington backed Kyiv's effort to get security guarantees, but touting nothing more concrete for now.】

item.title: 至关重要的 Nvidia 财报为摇摇欲坠的 "华丽七重奏 "指明方向
item.description: 随着科技公司收紧数据中心支出，周三发布的被视为人工智能芯片需求晴雨表的英伟达（Nvidia）财报可能会成为人工智能股票的一个拐点。【原文：Nvidia's much-awaited results - seen as a barometer of AI chip demand - on Wednesday could prove to be an inflection point for artificial intelligence stocks as technology companies tighten data center spending.】

item.title: 人工智能初创企业布里奇顿研究公司最新融资 1900 万美元
item.description: 人工智能初创公司布里奇敦研究公司（Bridgetown Research）周三表示，该公司已在一轮融资中筹集到1900万美元，该轮融资由风险投资公司光速创投（Lightspeed Venture Partners）和加速投资（Accel）领投，一家知名研究型大学也参与了投资。【原文：Artificial Intelligence startup Bridgetown Research said on Wednesday it had raised $19 million in a funding round led by venture capital firms Lightspeed Venture Partners and Accel, with participation from a leading research university.】

item.title: 继穆迪下调评级后，惠誉将日产汽车评级降至垃圾级
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）周三表示，已将日产汽车的评级从 BBB- 下调至垃圾级 BB+，原因是这家日本汽车制造商 "盈利能力持续低下，复苏轨迹延迟，与我们的预期不符"。【原文：Fitch Ratings said on Wednesday it has downgraded Nissan Motor's rating to junk-status BB+ from BBB-, referring to the Japanese automaker's "persistently low profitability, with a delayed recovery trajectory against our expectations".】

item.title: 3M 在投资者日之前重申 2025 年销售额预期
item.description: 3M 公司周三表示，这家多元化制造商预计到 2027 年营业利润率将达到 25% 左右，并重申其年度有机销售额增长预期在 2% 至 3% 之间。【原文：3M Co said on Wednesday the diversified manufacturer expects operating margin to be about 25% by 2027 and reaffirmed its annual forecast of organic sales growth in the range of 2% to 3%.】

item.title: Wolters Kluwer 长期首席执行官麦金斯特里将退休，股价暴跌
item.description: 荷兰信息服务公司 Wolters Kluwer 表示其长期首席执行官 Nancy McKinstry 将于明年初退休，该公司股价周三下跌约 9%。【原文：Shares in Wolters Kluwer fell around 9% on Wednesday after the Dutch information services firm said its long-time CEO Nancy McKinstry would retire early next year.】

item.title: 通用汽车将把股息提高 25%，再回购 60 亿美元股票
item.description: 通用汽车公司周三表示，将把季度股息提高 25%，并实施一项新的 60 亿美元股票回购计划，以返还多余现金并增加股东价值。【原文：General Motors said on Wednesday it would increase its quarterly dividend by 25% and undertake a new $6 billion share buyback program to return excess cash and increase shareholder value.】

item.title: 华尔街大跌后期货上涨；特朗普的减税计划成为焦点
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货走高，从之前几个交易日的大幅下跌中反弹，投资者关注备受期待的减税计划在国会的进展，并等待人工智能巨头英伟达（Nvidia）的重要业绩。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Wednesday, rebounding from steep losses in the previous sessions, as investors focused on the progress of a highly anticipated tax-cut plan through Congress and awaited crucial results from AI powerhouse Nvidia.】

item.title: 顾问称，特朗普的 500 万美元 "金卡 "签证不太可能吸引富有的投资者
item.description: 移民和财富顾问表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的500万美元所谓 "金卡 "签证计划不太可能引发全球富裕投资者大量涌入美国寻求入籍，因为他们担心税率会提高。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's $5 million so-called 'gold card' visa program is unlikely to trigger a major inflow of wealthy global investors seeking U.S citizenship because of concerns over higher taxes, immigration and wealth advisers said.】

item.title: 美国：信心受挫的股市找到立足点，Nvidia 备受期待
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 特朗普为卡特尔贴上恐怖主义标签，提高了公司被起诉的风险
item.description: 在拉丁美洲部分地区运营的美国公司有可能遭到美国起诉。【原文：There is a risk of U.S. prosecutions for American companies operating in parts of Latin America.】

item.title: 市场关注新一波欧洲联合债券，急于增强国防实力
item.description: 大型投资者们感觉到，随着欧洲地区争相增加国防开支，欧洲联合借贷的可能性正变得越来越大。【原文：Big investors are sensing that a fresh joint European borrowing effort is becoming more likely as the region scrambles to ramp up defence spending.】

item.title: 由于支出谨慎，劳氏公司的年度盈利预测基本低于预期
item.description: 周三，劳氏公司（Lowe's Cos）与竞争对手家得宝（Home Depot）一样，预测全年销售额和利润都将乏善可陈，这表明在利率走高的情况下，家装行业的低迷将持续下去。【原文：Lowe's Cos joined rival Home Depot in forecasting lackluster annual sales and profit on Wednesday, signaling that a downturn in the home improvement sector will linger amid higher interest rates.】

item.title: 亚马逊通过人工智能大修为 Alexa 寻找新方向
item.description: 亚马逊（Amazon）周三将举办一场活动，展示 Alexa 的新功能，将该服务带入生成式人工智能时代。【原文：Amazon on Wednesday is set to host an event showcasing new capabilities for Alexa that will bring the service into the age of generative artificial intelligence, more than a decade after it ushered in a wave of investment in voice assistants.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会建议为欧盟制造的清洁技术筹集 1000 亿欧元资金
item.description: 欧盟委员会周三提议提供 1,000 亿欧元（1,049.4 亿美元）支持欧盟制造的清洁制造业，作为其具有里程碑意义的 "清洁工业协议 "的一部分。【原文：The European Commission on Wednesday proposed making available 100 billion euros ($104.94 billion) to support EU-made clean manufacturing as part its landmark Clean Industrial Deal.】

item.title: 山德士家族将从出售诺华部分股权中获得 29 亿美元收益
item.description: 本周三，该交易的账簿管理人表示，桑德兹家族的投资机构将从出售瑞士制药巨头诺华的部分股份中获得 26 亿瑞士法郎（约合 29.0 亿美元）。【原文：The investment vehicle of the Sandoz family will get 2.6 billion Swiss francs ($2.90 billion) from selling a chunk of Swiss pharma giant Novartis , the bookrunner on the deal said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国 Deepseek 将非高峰期定价最高下调 75
item.description: 中国人工智能初创公司DeepSeek周三表示，在格林尼治标准时间16时30分至0时30分之间，使用其API（一个允许其他应用程序和网络产品开发商整合其人工智能模型的平台）的成本将降低75%。【原文：Chinese AI startup DeepSeek said on Wednesday that between 1630 GMT and 0030 GMT, the cost of using its API, a platform that allows developers of other apps and web products to integrate its AI models, would be up to 75% cheaper.】

item.title: 特朗普关税引发担忧，台湾小幅下调2025年GDP增长预期
item.description: 台湾经济依赖贸易，预计 2025 年的增长速度将低于之前的预测，美国可能征收的关税以及议会实施的预算削减将带来动荡威胁。【原文：Taiwan's trade-reliant economy is expected to grow at a slower pace in 2025 than previously forecast, with the threat of turbulence from tariffs that may be imposed by the United States, as well as parliament-imposed budget cuts.】

item.title: 德国大选后债券收益率小幅上升
item.description: 德国基准国债收益率周一上升，原因是德国大选结果支持了对有利于增长的政策的预期，但并未消除为增加财政支出而进行债务制动改革的不确定性。【原文：Yields on benchmark German government bonds rose on Monday as the outcome of German general elections supported expectations for pro-growth policies, but did not lift the uncertainty around the reform of the debt brake to increase fiscal spending.】

item.title: 聚焦：从时尚到汽车，俄罗斯市场对正在权衡回归的西方品牌构成新考验
item.description: 华盛顿推动迅速结束乌克兰冲突，引发了西方品牌可能希望重返俄罗斯的猜测，但从时装到汽车，他们撤出的市场现在看起来比三年前更具竞争力。【原文：Washington's push to swiftly end the conflict in Ukraine has sparked speculation that Western brands may want to return to Russia, but from fashion to cars, the markets they vacated now look more competitive than three years ago.】

item.title: 保时捷任命新首席财务官和销售主管以重振业绩
item.description: 豪华汽车制造商保时捷周三更换了首席财务官和销售主管，换上了两位公司资深人士，同时对董事会进行了重组，希望借此重振下滑的业绩和疲软的股价。【原文：Luxury carmaker Porsche replaced its CFO and head of sales on Wednesday with two company veterans as it reshuffles its board in the hopes of reviving flagging performance and a weak share price.】

item.title: 印度在 14 亿美元税款纠纷中单挑大众，称起亚纠正了方向
item.description: 法庭文件显示，尽管竞争对手起亚在被起诉后改变了做法，但印度税务部门仍将大众汽车列为唯一一家在 12 年中对其进口汽车进行错误分类以逃避 14 亿美元税款的汽车制造商。【原文：Indian tax authorities have singled out Volkswagen as the only automaker to wrongly classify its car imports for 12 years to evade $1.4 billion in taxes, even as rival Kia changed its practice after being pulled up, court papers show.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚将从 3 月 1 日起使用基准煤炭价格进行交易
item.description: 印尼能源与矿产资源部高级官员 Tri Winarno 周三表示，从 3 月 1 日起，印尼将开始使用政府制定的基准煤炭价格作为交易底价。【原文：Indonesia will start using its government-set benchmark coal price as the floor price for transactions starting from March 1, Tri Winarno, a senior official at the Energy and Mineral Resources Ministry, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Parexel 公司高管称印度即将成为临床试验中心
item.description: 合同研究公司Parexel的一位高管周三告诉路透社，印度已准备好作为早期临床试验的替代地点，以帮助减轻俄乌战争等干扰因素的影响。【原文：India is ready to step in as an alternative site for early-stage clinical trials to help mitigate the impact of disruptions such as the Russia-Ukraine war, an executive at contract research firm Parexel told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 印尼称苹果很快就能销售 iPhone 16s
item.description: 印尼工业部长周三表示，在双方就包括一家制造工厂和一个研发中心在内的多项交易达成一致后，苹果公司将很快能够在印尼销售其 iPhone 16 手机。【原文：Apple will soon be able to sell its iPhone 16 phones in Indonesia after the two sides agreed on a number of deals, including a manufacturing plant and a research and development centre, the industry minister said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国监管机构评估联合信贷银行收购德国商业银行 29.99% 股份的出价
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）的一位发言人周三表示，该银行已将其收购德国商业银行 29.99% 少数股权的计划上报德国卡特尔办公室进行评估。【原文：Italian lender UniCredit has reported its planned acquisition of a 29.99% minority stake in Germany's Commerzbank to the German Cartel Office for assessment, a spokesperson for the regulator said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚加强石油储备，寻求推迟美国对石油公司 NIS 的制裁
item.description: 塞尔维亚能源部长杜布拉夫卡-杰多维克-汉达诺维奇（Dubravka Djedovic Handanovic）周三表示，塞尔维亚正在加紧与美国和俄罗斯的谈判，以避免美国对其石油公司NIS的制裁，同时塞尔维亚正在加强其原油和燃料储备。【原文：Serbia is shoring up its crude oil and fuel reserves as the country presses on with talks with the United States and Russia to avoid U.S. sanctions on its oil company NIS, energy minister Dubravka Djedovic Handanovic said on Wednesday.】
